summary: Build SkillSwap, a modern responsive skill-sharing web app where users authenticate via Google, earn/spend points to watch short video lessons, and upload/manage videos with search/filter and dashboards backed by a structured database.
architectural_notes: Use a structured database schema for users, videos, and watch history with transactional/atomic updates for point transfers on video watch.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Modern wordmark logo reading “SkillSwap” with a simple swap/loop motif (skillswap-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Minimal monochrome favicon icon with swap/loop motif (skillswap-favicon.dim_128x128.png)

existing_features.title: Implement user authentication using Internet Identity and persist a user profile record on first login with an initial points balance of 100 points.

Implement video upload functionality: allow authenticated users to create a video lesson entry with title, description, category, and the video content; ensure the video can be played back from the Home feed and video detail view.
Build the Home page with a card-based video layout including search and category filtering across uploaded videos; include a simple navigation bar with routes: Home, Upload, Profile.
Create a Profile/Dashboard page that displays: user profile, current points balance, the user’s uploaded videos, and the user’s watched history.

Ensure the watch experience enforces points rules in the UI: disable/guard the watch action when the user has fewer than 10 points, and show clear English feedback for insufficient points; on successful watch, update displayed balances and creator info without full refresh.
Apply a clean, modern, mobile-friendly visual design with a coherent theme (colors, typography, spacing) and consistent components across pages; avoid using blue/purple as the primary brand palette.
Generate and include minimal static brand assets for the app (logo + favicon) and render them in the app shell/navigation.

new_feature_requests.summary: Google (Gmail) authentication for sign up/login and user profiles
Points system: start new users at 100 points; watching a video costs 10 points and transfers 10 points to the creator; block watching if <10 points
Video upload: creators can upload short skill videos with title, description, and category; display creator name and points earned
Dashboard/Profile: show user profile, current points balance, uploaded videos, and watched history
Home UI: clean modern mobile-friendly design with card-based video layout, search, category filter, and navbar (Home, Upload, Profile)
Database/data layer: store users, points, videos, and watch history; automatically update points when a video is watched
Responsive behavior and smooth UX on desktop and mobile browsers

Create backend data models and stable storage for users, videos, and watch history, including fields needed for: user points balance, video metadata (title, description, category, creator), and an append-only record of which user watched which video and when.

Implement the points transfer rule when watching a video: watching deducts 10 points from the learner and adds 10 points to the video creator; block watching if the learner has fewer than 10 points; record the watch event in watch history.
